matched_diseases.reasoning: The patient has a 10-year history of type 2 diabetes mellitus. His home glucose readings range from 120-180 mg/dL, and his last A1c was 7.8% three months ago, indicating suboptimal control. While he doesn't exhibit all classic symptoms, fatigue is present. The provided diagnostic criteria include HbA1c >= 6.5% and fasting plasma glucose >= 126 mg/dL, which the patient likely meets based on history and current glucose readings. The assessment also explicitly states 'Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus - Suboptimal control'.

The patient has a history of hypertension. His blood pressure today is elevated at 144/88, which is above the goal of <140/90. This persistent elevation of blood pressure meets the required diagnostic criteria. The assessment also explicitly states 'Essential Hypertension - Elevated today at 142/88, above goal of <140/90'.

clinical_summary: The patient is a 58-year-old male with a history of type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension. His diabetes is suboptimally controlled, and his blood pressure is elevated. He also reports occasional headaches and fatigue. Current management includes medication adjustments and lifestyle recommendations. Further investigation into the cause of fatigue is warranted, as is monitoring of renal function given medication adjustments.
